CORPORATE RESPONSIBILITY REPORT 202024 25FINANCIAL EDUCATION
Building 	financially-confident 	communities 	is	one	of	our	top	priorities. 	We	believe 	that		
commitment 	starts 	with	providing 	financial-education 	resources 	for	our	community. 		
That’s 	one	of	the	reasons 	we	partner 	with	EVERFI, 	one	of	the	country’s 	leading 	education- 	
technology 	companies, 	to	provide 	an	online 	financial-wellness 	program.
Powered 	by	EVERFI, 	People’s 	United 	Bank 	launched 	a	series 	of	online 	modules 	on		
peoples.com 	in	August 	of	2020. 	Between 	launch 	and	end-of-year, 	users 	accessed 	the		
modules 	in	the	Learn 	section 	of	peoples.com 	22,931 	times.
WORKPLACE BANKING 
In	2020, 	through 	our	Workplace 	Banking 	Program 	(WPB), 	People’s 	United 	Bank 	hosted 		
183	workshops 	in-person 	and	virtually, 	for	a	total 	of	more 	than 	200	hours. 	
Top topics: Basics 	of	Banking, 	Identity 	Theft 	Protection, 	Budgeting, 		
and	Credit 	Scores/Credit 	Report
WPB ONLINE PLATFORM
In	addition 	to	the	workshops, 	we	also	had	602	new	registrations 	on	our	WPB 	online- 		
learning 	platform 	with	EVERFI. 	These 	employees 	accessed 	2,456 	different 	learning 	modules, 	
with	College 	Finance s,	Banking 	Basic s,	and	Fr aud	Pre vention 	among 	the	mos t	popular 	topic s.
FINANCIAL-EDUCATION PARTNERSHIP WITH  
THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS
Since 	2017, 	People’s 	United 	Bank 	has	partnered 	with	the	Massachusetts 	State 	Treasury 	
Department, 	the	Office 	of	Economic 	Empowerment, 	the	Office 	of	Refugees 	and	Immigrants, 	
and	the	City	of	Worcester, 	MA	to	provide 	financial-education 	workshops 	to	underserved 		
populations 	and	communities. 	
Nearly 	80	workshops 	have 	been 	conducted 	throughout 	Massachusetts 	on	a	variety 	of		
financial 	topics, 	including 	the	basics 	of	banking, 	budgeting, 	credit, 	and	financial 	exploitation. 	
Primary 	demographic 	groups 	have 	included 	immigrants 	and	refugees, 	senior 	citizens, 	and	
victims 	of	domestic 	violence, 	in	addition 	to	Commonwealth 	employees.
Through 	our	partnership 	with	the	Commonwealth, 	People’s 	United 	Bank 	has	provided 		
financial-literacy 	programs 	in	collaboration 	with	Office 	of	Economic 	Empowerment, 	Office 		
of	Refugees 	and	Immigrants, 	and	the	City	of	Worcester, 	in	addition 	to	providing 	financial 		
education 	to	Employees 	of	the	State 	Treasury.
While 	continuing 	to	increase 	our	activities 	with	the	Office 	of	Economic 	Empowerment, 		
we	also	worked 	with	the	Jane 	Doe	Foundation 	and	the	Suffolk 	County 	Sheriff’s 	Department.
FRAUD-PREVENTION & AWARENESS 
Fraud-prevention 	measures 	in	2020 	included:
• Launched 	various 	messaging 	campaigns 	alerting 	customers 	to	prevalent 	scams 		
	 related 	to	COVID-19, 	stimulus, 	tax-ID 	theft, 	and	other 	fraudulent-caller 	phone 	scams, 		
	 and 	provided 	tips	for	prevention.• Partnered 	with	CT	Coalition 	for	Elder 	Justice, 	Protective 	Services, 	Dept. 	of	Banking, 	and		
	 Law 	Enforcement 	to	illustrate 	how	a	multi-disciplinary 	approach 	can	be	effective 	in		 	
	 prosecuting 	elder-fraud 	cases. 		
• Showcased 	thought 	leadership 	and	leveraged 	strategic 	partnerships, 	expanding 		
	 consumer 	outreach 	and	promoting 	collaboration 	through 	networking 	forums. 	
In	addition, 	People’s 	United’s 	Technology 	Risk	Management 	and	Fraud 	groups 	periodically 	
communicate 	directly 	to	customers 	through 	emails, 	social 	media, 	and	branch 	materials 	
regarding 	fraud 	and	information-security 	trends. 	
MISSION UNITED 
In	2020, 	People’s 	United 	Bank 	once 	again 	partnered 	with	United 	Way	of	Long 	Island 	for		
their 	“Mission 	United” 	campaign. 	Although 	different 	this	year, 	our	support 	continued 	to	help	
veterans 	and	their 	families 	on	Long 	Island. 	
The	Mission 	United 	initiative 	was	created 	to	help	veterans 	dealing 	with	a	life	emergency 	by	
providing 	service 	members 	and	their 	families 	with	immediate 	financial 	assistance. 	People’s 	
United 	Bank’s 	support 	of	Mission 	United 	2020 	helped 	100	military 	families 	with	personal 		
protective 	equipment 	(PPE) 	and	financial 	assistance 	that	allowed 	them 	to	meet 	urgent 	
needs, 	as	well	as	connecting 	them 	to	a	safety 	net	of	services 	through 	2-1-1	Long 	Island.
People’s 	United 	Bank’s 	partnership 	with	United 	Way	of	Long 	Island’s 	Mission 	United 		
Campaign 	is	dedicated 	to	helping 	our	vulnerable 	veterans 	and	families 	to	get	on	a	pathway 	
to	self-sufficiency.
COMMUNITY REINVESTMENT 
People’s 	United 	is	committed 	to	meeting 	the	credit 	needs 	of	all	areas 	we	serve, 	including 	
low-	and	moderate-income 	neighborhoods. 	We	comply 	with	the	letter 	and	spirit 	of	the		
Community 	Reinvestment 	Act	(CRA) 	by	combining 	our	philanthropic 	and	banking 	expertise 	
to	meet 	the	needs 	of	all	socioeconomic 	segments.
LENDING
Community-development 	lending 	at	People’s 	United 	is	focused 	on	low-	and	moderate- 	
income 	households 	and	communities 	and	includes 	an	array 	of	specialized 	products, 		
including 	home 	mortgages, 	small-business 	loans, 	economic-development 	loans, 	and	loans 	
for	affordable 	housing, 	supportive 	services, 	and	rural 	development.
INVESTMENTS 
People’s 	United 	Bank 	continually 	reviews 	opportunities 	to	deploy 	capital 	that	can	lead	to		
successful 	economic 	development, 	job	creation, 	and	affordable 	home 	ownership. 	We	work 		
with	the	Federal 	Home 	Loan 	Bank 	of	Boston, 	purchasing 	low-income-housing 	tax	credits, 		
state 	tax	credits, 	new-market 	tax	credits, 	renewable-energy 	tax	credits, 	and	historic 	tax		
credits, 	and	participating 	in	equity 	funds 	designed 	to	meet 	the	needs 	of	communities 	in		
our	banking 	markets. 	COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP MATTERS COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP MATTERS
